title: Cauliflower and Chickpea Coconut Curry
directions: Heat the coconut oil in a large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger and cook until softened, 5-7 minutes. Stir in the spices and cook until they're fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the chickpeas, tomatoes, coconut milk, and cauliflower. Increase the heat to medium-high and bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15 minutes. Uncover and cook 5 minutes more, or until sauce has thickened slightly. Season with salt and pepper to taste and garnish each serving with cilantro.
ingredients: 2 (15-ounce) cans chickpeas, drained and rinsed (or 3 cups cooked chickpeas)
1 medium head cauliflower, broken into florets
Cooked rice or naan for serving
